questions.text: Which nutritional deficiency is commonly associated with a chronic alcoholic presenting with a pruritic eczematous rash on the neck and dorsum of hands? (FMGE JANUARY 2024)

  • • Clofazimine is an antimicrobial agent used primarily in the treatment of leprosy. This occurs because clofazimine accumulates in the skin, leading to discoloration. The pigmentation typically appears as a reddish or brownish coloration and can be distressing for patients due to its noticeable cosmetic impact. The pigmentation is long-lasting and may take several months to years to fade after discontinuation of the drug.
